data.text: Is Footpath a Better Choice than Komoot for Bike Touring?

APPS! Hi everyone! I have a question about apps. Komoot seems to be the go to app for planning bike trips, I have, however, found and app called Footpath much more intuitive and better for loops. I am perfectly aware that as a pretty new Komoot user I might have just missed some cool options and I might prefer Footpath just because I was using it before. Has anyone used both? What was your experience? What other apps (besides obvious like Google maps) would you recommend for biking (and let‚Äôs not limit ourselves to route planning, as this post is gonna pop up in people‚Äôs searches, let‚Äôs make it useful for everyone) Cheers! üçª
Maps.me is great!

data.text: I use this on food delivery job ;))whit bike

data.text: Komoot best app. No doubt

data.author: Kay Anky JS

data.text: We have used a mix of Google, RidewithGPS, Maps.me, Komoot and Strava. We generally see what route each gives and try and find the options that suit us best. Sometimes we pick bits from multiple apps and combine them. We have found that checking the route using Google Street view helps make sure you do not end up on roads or paths you do not want to
data.author: Steve Molloy

data.text: Apps may be continent biased. RideWithGPS and Strava are popular in the US. Kamoot seems popular in Europe. I have used the website cycle.travel for planning, transferring GPX files to RWGPS for on road use. I am in America.
data.author: Peter Peter Brown Brown

data.text: RWGPS is also popular in Australia. It‚Äôs probably the default choice here, in my experience.
data.author: Sam Reich

data.text: What about going back to the good old paper Maps?
data.author: Winston Smith

data.text: bulky, difficult to use, and if you‚Äôre lost, you‚Äôre lost, as they don‚Äôt show you where you are ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è There is a very good reason no one uses them anymore...

data.text: MapsMe worked well enough for me, even on Cuba - if all you need is to find the best bicycle route. Work offline without a lot of advertisements and popups.

data.text: Did you like Cuba. Very interested in that ride just working a slew of logistics coming from US. Did you bring ur own bike or rent? Thx

data.text:
I liked it. Cuba is a genuine place, its safe an people friendly. I always carry my own folding bike. More on my blog: www.dagsresa.wordpress.com
